sen.j: 秋分の日（しゅうぶんのひ）は、秋分が起こる日である。
sen.e: The Autumnal Equinox Day is the day when the autumnal equinox occurs.
The Autumnal Equinox Day is the day when the autumnal equinox occurs.
The Autumnal Equinox Day is the day when the autumnal equinox occurs.

sen.j: しばしば、「昼と夜の長さが同じになる」といわれるが、実際は昼の方が長い。
sen.e: Although it is often said that this is one of two days a year when "the lengths of day and night will be equal," actually, the day is longer than the night.
sen.cmt: ※原文の情報のみで訳した場合、省略されている言葉があり英語として伝わりにくいため、言葉を補って訳しました。
sen.e: Although it is often said that this is one of two days a year when "the lengths of day and night will be equal," actually, the day is longer than the night.
sen.cmt: ダブルコーテーションをシングルコーテーションに修正しました。
sen.e: Although it is often said that this is one of two days a year when "the lengths of day and night will be equal," actually, the day is longer than the night.

sen.j: 詳細は秋分を参照のこと。
sen.e: For more details, see the Autumnal Equinox.
For details, see the Autumnal Equinox.
For details, see the Autumnal Equinox.

sen.j: 国民の祝日
sen.e: A National Holiday
National Holidays
National Holidays

sen.j: 日本では国民の祝日の1日になっている。
sen.e: In Japan, the Autumnal Equinox Day is a national holiday.
sen.cmt: ※原文の情報のみで訳した場合、省略されている言葉があり英語として伝わりにくいため、言葉を補って訳しました。
sen.e: It is one of the national holidays in Japan.
It is one of the national holidays in Japan.

sen.j: 1948年公布・施行の国民の祝日に関する法律（祝日法）によって制定された。
sen.e: It was decided in the law concerning national holidays (formally known as the Public Holiday Law) which was promulgated and enforced in 1948.
It was established by the Act on National Holidays that was promulgated and went into effect in 1948.
It was established by the Act on National Holidays that was promulgated and went into effect in 1948.

sen.j: 祝日法では「祖先をうやまい、なくなった人々をしのぶ」ことを趣旨としている。
sen.e: The Public Holiday Law explains that the purpose of the holiday is "to respect our ancestors and remember the dead."
According to the Act, the purpose of the holiday is 'to respect our ancestors and remember the deceased.'
According to the Act, the purpose of the holiday is 'to respect our ancestors and remember the deceased.'

sen.j: 1947年までは、秋季皇霊祭という祭日だった。
sen.e: Until 1947, it was a holiday called Shuki-koreisai (the religious rite held by the Emperor of Japan to worship the Japanese imperial ancestors at the korei-den shrine.)
sen.cmt: ※「秋季皇霊祭」の意味は広辞苑を参照しました→「天皇が毎年秋分の日に、皇霊殿で歴代の天皇・皇后・皇親の霊を祀る祭祀。」
sen.e: Until 1947, it was a holiday called "shukikoreisai" (imperial ceremony of ancestor worship formerly held on the autumnal equinox).
sen.cmt: Shuki-koreisai (the religious rite held by the Emperor of Japan to worship the Japanese imperial ancestors at the korei-den shrine.) を"shukikoreisai" (imperial ceremony of ancestor worship formerly held on the autumnal equinox) に修正しました。
sen.e: Until 1947, it was a holiday called "shukikoreisai" (imperial ceremony of ancestor worship formerly held on the autumnal equinox).

sen.j: 日本の仏教各派ではこの日「秋季彼岸会」が行われ、宗派問わず墓参りをする人も多い。
sen.e: Since each school of Buddhism holds "Shuki Higan-e" (a Buddhist holiday celebrated in Japan at the times of the Spring and Autumn Equinoxes) on the day, many Japanese people, regardless of their religions, visit their ancestors' graves.
On this day, 'Shuki Higan-E' (Autumnal Equinox Service) is held at each sect of Buddhism in Japan and many people visit their family graves regardless of their sects.
On this day, 'Shuki Higan-E' (Autumnal Equinox Service) is held at each sect of Buddhism in Japan and many people visit their family graves regardless of their sects.

sen.j: 日付
sen.e: Date
Date
Date

sen.j: 秋分の日は毎年9月23日ごろ。
sen.e: The Autumnal Equinox Day is around September 23 of each year.
The Autumnal Equinox Day falls around September 23 of each year.
sen.cmt: is を falls に修正しました。
sen.e: The Autumnal Equinox Day falls around September 23 of each year.

sen.j: 祝日法の上では「秋分日」としており、地球が秋分点を通過する日（日本時間）としている。
sen.e: The Public Holiday Law states that the day is "Shubun-bi," when the earth passes the Autumnal Equinoctial Point (Japan time).
Under the Act on National Holidays, it is set as 'the autumn equinox,' when the earth passes the Autumnal Equinoctial Point (Japan time).
sen.cmt: 前半部を全文修正しました。
sen.e: Under the Act on National Holidays, it is set as 'the autumn equinox,' when the earth passes the Autumnal Equinoctial Point (Japan time).

sen.j: 国立天文台が作成する『暦象年表』という小冊子に基づいて閣議で決定され、前年2月第1平日付の官報で発表される。
sen.e: The day will be decided at a Cabinet meeting on the basis of the booklet called "Rekisho Nenpyo" (Calendar and Ephemeris) created by the National Astronomical Observatory of Japan and announced in an official gazette as of the previous year's first weekday of February.

The day is decided at Cabinet meetings based on the booklet called " Calendar and Ephemeris "created by the National Astronomical Observatory of Japan and is announced in an official gazette as of the first weekday in February of the previous year.

The day is decided at Cabinet meetings based on the booklet called " Calendar and Ephemeris "created by the National Astronomical Observatory of Japan and is announced in an official gazette as of the first weekday in February of the previous year.

sen.j: よって、2年後以降の秋分の日の日付は確定していないことになるが、これまでに、天文計算によって求められた春分の日付以外の日が春分の日とされたことはない。
sen.e: This means that the date of the Autumnal Equinox Day for two years from now or later has not been fixed.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Therefore, the dates of the Autumnal Equinox Day two years and beyond have not been fixed; however, days other than autumnal equinox day obtained by an astronomical calculation has never been set as the Autumnal Equinox Day so far.
sen.cmt: 原文を一文に戻して、英文を全文修正しました。
sen.e: Therefore, the dates of the Autumnal Equinox Day two years and beyond have not been fixed; however, days other than autumnal equinox day obtained by an astronomical calculation has never been set as the Autumnal Equinox Day so far.

sen.j: なお天文計算上、2011年までは毎年9月23日で変わらない。
sen.e: Due to the astronomical calculation issues, until 2011, the Autumnal Equinox Day will be held on September 23 each year; however, after that until 2044, the Autumnal Equinox Day will be September 22 on a leap year and September 23 on a common year..

In addition, based on the astronomical calculation, the Autumnal Equinox Day falls on September 23 every year until 2011; however, after that, it falls on September 22 on leap years and September 23 in other years until 2044.
sen.cmt: 全文修正しました。※原文が「～で変わらない。その後～」と2文になっていますが、ウィキペディアの当該箇所は「～で変わらず、その後～」と1文になっているようです。
sen.e: In addition, based on the astronomical calculation, the Autumnal Equinox Day falls on September 23 every year until 2011.
sen.cmt: チェッカーのコメントにあるように、原文は２文になっているので、原文通り2文に分けました。一原文一訳文の例外処理

sen.j: その後2044年までは閏年に限り9月22日になり、平年は9月23日と計算される。
sen.e: However, after that, it falls on September 22 on leap years and September 23 in other years until 2044.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外処理

sen.j: ハッピーマンデー適用による影響
sen.e: The influence of applying the Happy Monday system
The influence of applying the Happy Monday System
sen.cmt: system を System に修正しました。
sen.e: The influence of applying the Happy Monday System

sen.j: 従来9月15日だった敬老の日が、祝日法の改正（いわゆるハッピーマンデー制度）により、2003年から9月第3月曜という移動日に変更された。
sen.e: Due to the revision of the Public Holiday Law (so called the Happy Monday system), the Respect for the Aged Day used to be celebrated on September 15 was changed to the third Monday in September from 2003.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Due to the revision of the Act on National Holidays (so called the "Happy Monday System"), Respect for the Aged Day which used to be celebrated on September 15 was changed to the third Monday in September from 2003.

Due to the revision of the Act on National Holidays (so called the "Happy Monday System"), Respect for the Aged Day which used to be celebrated on September 15 was changed to the third Monday in September from 2003.

sen.j: それにより、9月21日、または20日が敬老の日となるケースが発生することとなった。
sen.e: This resulted in that the Respect for the Aged Day was observed on September 21 or 20, depending on the year.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Because of the change, Respect for the Aged Day came to fall on September 21 or 20 in some years.
Because of the change, Respect for the Aged Day came to fall on September 21 or 20 in some years.

sen.j: もし、敬老の日が9月21日で、続く秋分の日が9月23日となるか、敬老の日が9月20日で秋分の日が9月22日となる場合、祝日法の規定により間に挟まれる日（それぞれ22日か21日）が国民の休日とみなされる。
sen.e: When September 21 or 20 will be the Respect for the Aged Day and September 23 or 22 will be the Autumnal Equinox Day, the day sandwiched between the Respect for the Aged Day and the Autumnal Equinox Day (22 or 21) is regarded as a national holiday due to a provision of the Public Holiday Law.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: When September 21 or 20 will be the Respect for the Aged Day and September 23 or 22 will be the Autumnal Equinox Day, the day sandwiched between the Respect for the Aged Day and the Autumnal Equinox Day (22 or 21) is regarded as a national holiday due to a provision of the Act on National Holidays.
sen.cmt: Public Holiday Law をAct on National Holidays に修正しました。
sen.e: When September 21 or 20 will be the Respect for the Aged Day and September 23 or 22 will be the Autumnal Equinox Day, the day sandwiched between the Respect for the Aged Day and the Autumnal Equinox Day (22 or 21) is regarded as a national holiday due to a provision of the Act on National Holidays.

sen.j: そのため敬老の日前日の日曜から4連休（週休2日制であれば5連休）となる。
sen.e: In this case, starting from the Sunday, the day before the Respect for the Aged Day, the weekend will be a four-day weekend (a five-day weekend for those who have a five-day work week).
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: In this case, starting from the Sunday, the day before the Respect for the Aged Day, the weekend will be a four-day weekend (a five-day weekend for those who have a five-day work week).
In this case, starting from the Sunday, the day before the Respect for the Aged Day, the weekend will be a four-day weekend (a five-day weekend for those who have a five-day work week).

sen.j: そのため、「第2のゴールデンウィーク」（または、敬老の日が関係するため、ゴールデンウィークに対して「シルバーウィーク」とも）が誕生するとも言われている。
sen.e: Because of this, it is said that "the second Golden Week" (or since the Respect for the Aged Day is included, it might be called "Silver Week" as opposed to the Golden Week [a collection of spring holidays in Japan]) may be created.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Because of this, it is said that 'the second Golden Week' (or since the Respect for the Aged Day is included, it might be called 'Silver Week' as opposed to the Golden Week [a collection of spring holidays in Japan]) may be created.
sen.cmt: ダブルコーテーションをシングルコーテーションに修正しました。
sen.e: Because of this, it is said that 'the second Golden Week' (or since the Respect for the Aged Day is included, it might be called 'Silver Week' as opposed to the Golden Week [a collection of spring holidays in Japan]) may be created.

sen.j: ちなみに、敬老の日と秋分の日の両祝日及び国民の休日について今後祝日法が改正されない限り、このケースが最初に発生するのは2009年、次いで2015年の見込である（ともに敬老の日が9月21日で秋分の日が23日）。
sen.e: It is also expected that the first year when the above case can be applied will be 2009 and next year will be 2015 (in both years, the Respect for the Aged Day will be September 21 and the Autumnal Equinox Day will be September 23), unless the Public Holiday Law regarding the both holidays (the Respect for the Aged Day and the Autumnal Equinox Day) and the national holiday will be revised in the future.
sen.cmt: ※2009年はすでに過ぎていますが、原文通りの時制で訳しました。※原文の情報を整理して伝えるため、原文には記載されていない箇所で()を使用しました。
sen.e: It is also expected that the first year when the above case can be applied will be 2009 and next year will be 2015 (in both years, the Respect for the Aged Day will be September 21 and the Autumnal Equinox Day will be September 23), unless the Act on National Holidays regarding the both holidays (the Respect for the Aged Day and the Autumnal Equinox Day) and the national holiday will be revised in the future.
sen.cmt: Public Holiday Law をAct on National Holidays に修正しました。
sen.e: It is also expected that the first year when the above case can be applied will be 2009 and next year will be 2015 (in both years, the Respect for the Aged Day will be September 21 and the Autumnal Equinox Day will be September 23), unless the Act on National Holidays regarding the both holidays (the Respect for the Aged Day and the Autumnal Equinox Day) and the national holiday will be revised in the future.

sen.j: なお、2020年は、敬老の日が9月21日になるものの、秋分の日が9月22日となる見込（天文計算上）。
sen.e: In 2020, it is expected that the Respect for the Aged Day will be September 21 and the Autumnal Equinox Day will be September 22 (according to the astronomical calculations).
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: In 2020, it is expected that the Respect for the Aged Day will fall on September 21 and the Autumnal Equinox Day will fall on September 22 (according to the astronomical calculations).
sen.cmt: be を fall on に修正しました。
sen.e: In 2020, it is expected that the Respect for the Aged Day will fall on September 21 and the Autumnal Equinox Day will fall on September 22 (according to the astronomical calculations).

sen.j: 2日連続で祝日となるため上記のケースとはならない。
sen.e: Since it will be a two-day holiday, the above case will not be applied.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Since it will be a two-day holiday, the above case will not be applied.
Since it will be a two-day holiday, the above case will not be applied.

sen.j: 続く2021年は、敬老の日が9月20日になるものの、秋分の日が9月22日ではなく23日になる見込。
sen.e: In the next year of 2021, it is expected that the Respect for the Aged Day will be September 20, but the Autumnal Equinox Day will not be September 22 but be September 23.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: In the next year of 2021, it is expected that the Respect for the Aged Day will fall on September 20, but the Autumnal Equinox Day will not fall on September 22 but on September 23.
sen.cmt: be を fall on に修正しました。
sen.e: In the next year of 2021, it is expected that the Respect for the Aged Day will fall on September 20, but the Autumnal Equinox Day will not fall on September 22 but on September 23.

sen.j: やはり上記のケースとはならない。
sen.e: The above case will also not be applied to the year.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: The above case will also not be applied to the year.
The above case will also not be applied to the year.

sen.j: 2032年には、敬老の日が9月20日、秋分の日が9月22日になるため、9月21日が国民の休日になる。
sen.e: In 2032, September 21 will be a national holiday because the Respect for the Aged Day will be September 20 and the Autumnal Equinox Day will be September 22.
In 2032, September 21 will fall on a national holiday because the Respect for the Aged Day will fall on September 20 and the Autumnal Equinox Day will fall on September 22.
sen.cmt: be を fall on に修正しました。
sen.e: In 2032, September 21 will fall on a national holiday because the Respect for the Aged Day will fall on September 20 and the Autumnal Equinox Day will fall on September 22.

sen.j: 2099年までに該当するのは以下の予定である。
sen.e: Until 2099, the following years meet the condition mentioned above:
sen.cmt: 後列の部分と一緒に「以下の予定である」としました。
sen.e: Until 2099, the following years meet the condition mentioned above:
Until 2099, the following years meet the condition mentioned above:

sen.cmt: セミコロン以下を修正しました。

sen.e: The pattern of September 18 - 22: 2032, 2049, 2060, 2077, 2088, and 2094 years.
The pattern of September 18 - 22: year 2032, 2049, 2060, 2077, 2088, 2094
sen.cmt: セミコロン以下を修正しました。
sen.e: The pattern of September 18 - 22: year 2032, 2049, 2060, 2077, 2088, 2094

sen.j: （正式には各前年2月第1平日付の官報告示で決定される）
sen.e: (Formally, the decision will be announced in an official gazette as of the previous year's first weekday of February.)
(Formally, the decision will be announced in an official gazette as of the first weekend in February of the previous year.)
sen.cmt: the previous year's first weekday of February をthe first weekend in February of the previous year に修正しました。
sen.e: (Formally, the decision will be announced in an official gazette as of the first weekend in February of the previous year.)
